security_audit.summary: Legitimate AI learning assistant skill with local data storage. All data stays on user's machine via ChromaDB. Network access only for downloading embedding model from HuggingFace.

low_findings.title: Filesystem access to user notes directory
low_findings.description: The skill scans project 'notes/' directory to process markdown files. This is expected behavior for a note processing skill. Access is limited to notes directory within projects where the skill is activated.

low_findings.title: Model download from HuggingFace
low_findings.description: The BAAI/bge-m3 embedding model (~4.3GB) is downloaded from HuggingFace on first run. This is documented and necessary for vector embeddings. Model cached locally for subsequent runs.

content.value_statement: Users struggle to retain and reuse knowledge across projects. AI Partner Chat 2.0 creates a long-term memory system that automatically indexes notes, conversations, and code snippets using vector embeddings, enabling personalized context-aware responses.
actual_capabilities: Automatically process markdown notes and extract code blocks
Store and retrieve conversations and notes using vector embeddings
Generate hierarchical tags for content organization
Analyze learning emotions and thinking patterns
Search across notes, conversations, and code with semantic similarity
Generate weekly learning reports with insights
limitations: Requires Python virtual environment with specific dependencies
First run downloads 4.3GB embedding model from HuggingFace
Memory limited to ChromaDB storage capacity
Does not sync data across multiple devices

use_cases.title: Track learning progress
use_cases.description: Record study notes and track learning patterns with emotional analysis and progress reports

use_cases.title: Remember code solutions
use_cases.description: Store and find code snippets, solutions, and technical decisions across different projects

use_cases.title: Personalize AI interactions
use_cases.description: Build context-aware conversations where AI remembers your background and preferences

prompt_templates.title: Quick note capture
prompt_templates.prompt: Process this note about [topic] from my notes directory. [Paste note content]

prompt_templates.title: Context retrieval
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on my previous notes about [topic], help me understand [new question]

prompt_templates.title: Weekly review
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate my weekly learning report summarizing what I learned about [topics]

prompt_templates.title: Code recall
prompt_templates.prompt: Search my memory for code related to [functionality or problem]

output_examples.input: Process my new React hooks note
output: ğŸ“š Ready for semantic search in future conversations

best_practices: Create a dedicated notes directory in each project for automatic processing
Use consistent naming conventions for notes to improve retrieval
Configure user and AI personas for more personalized responses
Review weekly reports to identify learning patterns and gaps
anti_patterns: Storing sensitive information like passwords or API keys in notes
Using the skill without a virtual environment causing dependency conflicts
Expecting real-time synchronization across multiple devices
Deleting the data directory without backing up important memories

faq.question: Is my data stored locally or sent to external servers?
faq.answer: All data stays on your machine. Conversations and notes are stored in a local ChromaDB database. The only network call downloads the embedding model from HuggingFace.

faq.question: How much disk space does this skill require?
faq.answer: The BAAI/bge-m3 model needs ~4.3GB (one-time download). Each content chunk uses ~5KB for vector storage. 1000 chunks = approximately 5MB.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with multiple projects?
faq.answer: Yes. All projects share the same vector database, enabling true cross-project knowledge accumulation. Each project can have its own config directory with custom personas.

faq.question: How does the skill protect my privacy?
faq.answer: No data is sent to external servers. You control the data directory location. All processing happens locally using Python libraries. The skill never shares your conversations or notes.

faq.question: What if the model download fails or is slow?
faq.answer: The model downloads once and caches to ~/.cache/huggingface/hub/. For slow connections, manually download using the Python sentence-transformers library with progress display enabled.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude's built-in context?
faq.answer: Built-in context resets per session. This skill creates persistent long-term memory that survives across sessions, projects, and even weeks or months. It uses vector similarity for intelligent retrieval.
